t: Psalm 106
Joy in Forgiveness of Israel’s Sins
Praise*pn the Lord!*s Oh,*ln give thanks to the Lord,*s for He*i is*i good! For*ld His mercy endures*i forever.
Who*ln can utter the mighty acts of the Lord?*s Who*ld can declare all His praise?
Blessed*ld are*i those who keep justice, And*ild he who does righteousness at all times!
Remember*ln me, O Lord,*s with the favor You*i have*i toward*i Your people. Oh,*ld visit me with Your salvation,
That*ld I may see the benefit of Your chosen ones, That*ld I may rejoice in the gladness of Your nation, That*ld I may glory with Your inheritance.
We*ln have sinned with our fathers, We*ld have committed iniquity, We*ld have done wickedly.
Our*ld fathers in Egypt did not understand Your wonders; They*ld did not remember the multitude of Your mercies, But*ld rebelled by the sea—the Red Sea.
Nevertheless*ln He saved them for His name’s sake, That*ld He might make His mighty power known.
He*ld rebuked the Red Sea also, and it dried up; So*ld He led them through the depths, As*ld through the wilderness.
He*ld saved them from the hand of him who hated them,*i And*ld redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
The*ld waters covered their enemies; There*ld was not one of them left.
Then*ld they believed His words; They*ld sang His praise.
They*ln soon forgot His works; They*ld did not wait for His counsel,
But*ld lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, And*ld tested God in the desert.
And*ld He gave them their request, But*ld sent leanness into their soul.
When*ln they envied Moses in the camp, And*ild Aaron the saint of the Lord,*s
The*ld earth opened up and swallowed Dathan, And*ld covered the faction of Abiram.
A*ld fire was kindled in their company; The*ld flame burned up the wicked.
They*ln made a calf in Horeb, And*ld worshiped the molded image.
Thus*ld they changed their glory Into*ld the image of an ox that eats grass.
They*ld forgot God their Savior, Who*ld had done great things in Egypt,
Wondrous*ld works in the land of Ham, Awesome*ld things by the Red Sea.
Therefore*ld He said that He would destroy them, Had*ld not Moses His chosen one stood before Him in the breach, To*ld turn away His wrath, lest He destroy them.*i
Then*ln they despised the pleasant land; They*ld did not believe His word,
But*ld complained in their tents, And*ild did not heed the voice of the Lord.*s
Therefore*ld He raised His hand in*i an*i oath*i against them, To*ld overthrow them in the wilderness,
To*ld overthrow their descendants among the nations, And*ld to scatter them in the lands.
They*ln joined themselves also to Baal of Peor, And*ld ate sacrifices made to the dead.
Thus*ld they provoked Him*i to anger with their deeds, And*ld the plague broke out among them.
Then*ld Phinehas stood up and intervened, And*ld the plague was stopped.
And*ld that was accounted to him for righteousness To*ld all generations forevermore.
They*ln angered Him*i also at the waters of strife, So*ld that it went ill with Moses on account of them;
Because*ld they rebelled against His Spirit, So*ld that he spoke rashly with his lips.
They*ln did not destroy the peoples, Concerning*ld whom the Lord*s had commanded them,
But*ld they mingled with the Gentiles And*ld learned their works;
They*ld served their idols, Which*ld became a snare to them.
They*ld even sacrificed their sons And*ld their daughters to demons,
And*ld shed innocent blood, The*ld blood of their sons and daughters, Whom*ld they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; And*ld the land was polluted with blood.
Thus*ld they were defiled by their own works, And*ld played the harlot by their own deeds.
Therefore*ln the wrath of the Lord*s was kindled against His people, So*ld that He abhorred His own inheritance.
And*ld He gave them into the hand of the Gentiles, And*ld those who hated them ruled over them.
Their*ld enemies also oppressed them, And*ld they were brought into subjection under their hand.
Many*ld times He delivered them; But*ld they rebelled in their counsel, And*ld were brought low for their iniquity.
Nevertheless*ln He regarded their affliction, When*ld He heard their cry;
And*ld for their sake He remembered His covenant, And*ld relented according to the multitude of His mercies.
He*ld also made them to be pitied By*ld all those who carried them away captive.
Save*ln us, O Lord*s our God, And*ld gather us from among the Gentiles, To*ld give thanks to Your holy name, To*ld triumph in Your praise.
Blessed*ln be*i the Lord*s God of Israel From*ld everlasting to everlasting! And*ld let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise*ln the Lord!*s
